moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. exd5 exd5 5. Nf3
comment: This form of the exchange variation is now considered harmless.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. exd5 exd5 5. Nf3 Bd6 6. Bd3 O-O 7. O-O h6
comment: 7...c6 would have been wiser. Black is overly concerned with the g5-square.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. exd5 exd5 5. Nf3 Bd6 6. Bd3 O-O 7. O-O h6 8. Re1 Nc6 9. Nb5
comment:
Bird: The opening is much as usual, this move and Mr. Mason's
play to preserve his bishop from being changed off taking it a little out of
the beaten track.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. exd5 exd5 5. Nf3 Bd6 6. Bd3 O-O 7. O-O h6 8. Re1 Nc6 9. Nb5 Bb4 10. c3 Ba5 11. Na3 Bg4 12. Nc2 Qd7
1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. exd5 exd5 5. Nf3 Bd6 6. Bd3 O-O 7. O-O h6 8. Re1 Nc6 9. Nb5 Bb4 10. c3 Ba5 11. Na3 Bg4 12. Nc2 Qd7 13. b4 Bb6 14. h3 Bh5 15. Ne3 Rfe8 16. b5 Ne7 17. g4 Bg6 18. Ne5
comment:
White has advanced pawns and the structure is a
bit weak. Therefore the initiative must be maintained. Notice that the advance
of the h-pawn has weakened g6.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. exd5 exd5 5. Nf3 Bd6 6. Bd3 O-O 7. O-O h6 8. Re1 Nc6 9. Nb5 Bb4 10. c3 Ba5 11. Na3 Bg4 12. Nc2 Qd7 13. b4 Bb6 14. h3 Bh5 15. Ne3 Rfe8 16. b5 Ne7 17. g4 Bg6 18. Ne5 Qc8
comment:
The queen would have been better
placed at d8, so that after ...Ne4 the kingside could be infiltrated on the
dark squares.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. exd5 exd5 5. Nf3 Bd6 6. Bd3 O-O 7. O-O h6 8. Re1 Nc6 9. Nb5 Bb4 10. c3 Ba5 11. Na3 Bg4 12. Nc2 Qd7 13. b4 Bb6 14. h3 Bh5 15. Ne3 Rfe8 16. b5 Ne7 17. g4 Bg6 18. Ne5 Qc8 19. a4
comment:
White could have played 19.Nxg6 Nxg6 20.Bxg6 fxg6 21.
Qd3 but Black has a strong reply in 21...Kh7 22.Bd2 Qd8 followed by ...Ne4.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. exd5 exd5 5. Nf3 Bd6 6. Bd3 O-O 7. O-O h6 8. Re1 Nc6 9. Nb5 Bb4 10. c3 Ba5 11. Na3 Bg4 12. Nc2 Qd7 13. b4 Bb6 14. h3 Bh5 15. Ne3 Rfe8 16. b5 Ne7 17. g4 Bg6 18. Ne5 Qc8 19. a4 c6

1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. exd5 exd5 5. Nf3 Bd6 6. Bd3 O-O 7. O-O h6 8. Re1 Nc6 9. Nb5 Bb4 10. c3 Ba5 11. Na3 Bg4 12. Nc2 Qd7 13. b4 Bb6 14. h3 Bh5 15. Ne3 Rfe8 16. b5 Ne7 17. g4 Bg6 18. Ne5 Qc8 19. a4 c6 20. bxc6 bxc6 21. Ba3 Ne4 22. Qc2 Ng5 23. Bxe7 Rxe7 24. Bxg6 fxg6 25. Qxg6 Nxh3+ 26. Kh2 Nf4 27. Qf5 Ne6 28. Ng2 Qc7 29. a5
comment:
Not a brilliancy, as generally
considered, but a terrible mistake. Bird: This move initiates a combination of
remarkable interest, besides affording scope for some of the best play of both
of these well-known players.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. exd5 exd5 5. Nf3 Bd6 6. Bd3 O-O 7. O-O h6 8. Re1 Nc6 9. Nb5 Bb4 10. c3 Ba5 11. Na3 Bg4 12. Nc2 Qd7 13. b4 Bb6 14. h3 Bh5 15. Ne3 Rfe8 16. b5 Ne7 17. g4 Bg6 18. Ne5 Qc8 19. a4 c6 20. bxc6 bxc6 21. Ba3 Ne4 22. Qc2 Ng5 23. Bxe7 Rxe7 24. Bxg6 fxg6 25. Qxg6 Nxh3+ 26. Kh2 Nf4 27. Qf5 Ne6 28. Ng2 Qc7 29. a5 Bxa5 30. Rxa5
comment: The best follow up, from a practical standpoint. But is it any good?

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. exd5 exd5 5. Nf3 Bd6 6. Bd3 O-O 7. O-O h6 8. Re1 Nc6 9. Nb5 Bb4 10. c3 Ba5 11. Na3 Bg4 12. Nc2 Qd7 13. b4 Bb6 14. h3 Bh5 15. Ne3 Rfe8 16. b5 Ne7 17. g4 Bg6 18. Ne5 Qc8 19. a4 c6 20. bxc6 bxc6 21. Ba3 Ne4 22. Qc2 Ng5 23. Bxe7 Rxe7 24. Bxg6 fxg6 25. Qxg6 Nxh3+ 26. Kh2 Nf4 27. Qf5 Ne6 28. Ng2 Qc7 29. a5 Bxa5 30. Rxa5 Rf8 31. Ra6
comment:
Bird: A note to this game in the Illustrated London News observed "This is
quite a la Bird. For once in a way our countryman wakes up and comes out in
his old brilliant style."

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. exd5 exd5 5. Nf3 Bd6 6. Bd3 O-O 7. O-O h6 8. Re1 Nc6 9. Nb5 Bb4 10. c3 Ba5 11. Na3 Bg4 12. Nc2 Qd7 13. b4 Bb6 14. h3 Bh5 15. Ne3 Rfe8 16. b5 Ne7 17. g4 Bg6 18. Ne5 Qc8 19. a4 c6 20. bxc6 bxc6 21. Ba3 Ne4 22. Qc2 Ng5 23. Bxe7 Rxe7 24. Bxg6 fxg6 25. Qxg6 Nxh3+ 26. Kh2 Nf4 27. Qf5 Ne6 28. Ng2 Qc7 29. a5 Bxa5 30. Rxa5 Rf8 31. Ra6 Rxf5 32. gxf5 Nd8 33. Nf4 Qc8 34. Nfg6 Re8 35. Nxc6
comment:
There really isn't anything better, but the move
doesn't really deserve the double exclamation mark it usually gets. Bird: "If
in reply Black takes the rook at e1 he loses his queen; if he captures the
other rook he is mated. Capturing the knight was available, but looks
extremely dangerous."

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. exd5 exd5 5. Nf3 Bd6 6. Bd3 O-O 7. O-O h6 8. Re1 Nc6 9. Nb5 Bb4 10. c3 Ba5 11. Na3 Bg4 12. Nc2 Qd7 13. b4 Bb6 14. h3 Bh5 15. Ne3 Rfe8 16. b5 Ne7 17. g4 Bg6 18. Ne5 Qc8 19. a4 c6 20. bxc6 bxc6 21. Ba3 Ne4 22. Qc2 Ng5 23. Bxe7 Rxe7 24. Bxg6 fxg6 25. Qxg6 Nxh3+ 26. Kh2 Nf4 27. Qf5 Ne6 28. Ng2 Qc7 29. a5 Bxa5 30. Rxa5 Rf8 31. Ra6 Rxf5 32. gxf5 Nd8 33. Nf4 Qc8 34. Nfg6 Re8 35. Nxc6 Qc7+
comment: Generally criticized, but maybe not so bad after all.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. exd5 exd5 5. Nf3 Bd6 6. Bd3 O-O 7. O-O h6 8. Re1 Nc6 9. Nb5 Bb4 10. c3 Ba5 11. Na3 Bg4 12. Nc2 Qd7 13. b4 Bb6 14. h3 Bh5 15. Ne3 Rfe8 16. b5 Ne7 17. g4 Bg6 18. Ne5 Qc8 19. a4 c6 20. bxc6 bxc6 21. Ba3 Ne4 22. Qc2 Ng5 23. Bxe7 Rxe7 24. Bxg6 fxg6 25. Qxg6 Nxh3+ 26. Kh2 Nf4 27. Qf5 Ne6 28. Ng2 Qc7 29. a5 Bxa5 30. Rxa5 Rf8 31. Ra6 Rxf5 32. gxf5 Nd8 33. Nf4 Qc8 34. Nfg6 Re8 35. Nxc6 Qc7+ 36. Nce5 Qxc3 37. Re3 Qd2 38. Kg2 Qxd4 39. f6
comment: Bird: This pawn comes forward now with much force.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. exd5 exd5 5. Nf3 Bd6 6. Bd3 O-O 7. O-O h6 8. Re1 Nc6 9. Nb5 Bb4 10. c3 Ba5 11. Na3 Bg4 12. Nc2 Qd7 13. b4 Bb6 14. h3 Bh5 15. Ne3 Rfe8 16. b5 Ne7 17. g4 Bg6 18. Ne5 Qc8 19. a4 c6 20. bxc6 bxc6 21. Ba3 Ne4 22. Qc2 Ng5 23. Bxe7 Rxe7 24. Bxg6 fxg6 25. Qxg6 Nxh3+ 26. Kh2 Nf4 27. Qf5 Ne6 28. Ng2 Qc7 29. a5 Bxa5 30. Rxa5 Rf8 31. Ra6 Rxf5 32. gxf5 Nd8 33. Nf4 Qc8 34. Nfg6 Re8 35. Nxc6 Qc7+ 36. Nce5 Qxc3 37. Re3 Qd2 38. Kg2 Qxd4 39. f6 gxf6 40. Rxf6 Ne6 41. Rg3 Ng5 42. Ng4 Kg7
comment:
(42...Qe4+ 43.Kh2 d4 looks very strong for Black. 44.Nxh6+ Kg7 45.
Ng4 doesn't change things, and the d-pawn keeps marching. 45...d3 46. Rd6 Re6
47.Rxe6 Qxe6 48.Nf4 Qd6 49.Nxd3 Ne4!)

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. exd5 exd5 5. Nf3 Bd6 6. Bd3 O-O 7. O-O h6 8. Re1 Nc6 9. Nb5 Bb4 10. c3 Ba5 11. Na3 Bg4 12. Nc2 Qd7 13. b4 Bb6 14. h3 Bh5 15. Ne3 Rfe8 16. b5 Ne7 17. g4 Bg6 18. Ne5 Qc8 19. a4 c6 20. bxc6 bxc6 21. Ba3 Ne4 22. Qc2 Ng5 23. Bxe7 Rxe7 24. Bxg6 fxg6 25. Qxg6 Nxh3+ 26. Kh2 Nf4 27. Qf5 Ne6 28. Ng2 Qc7 29. a5 Bxa5 30. Rxa5 Rf8 31. Ra6 Rxf5 32. gxf5 Nd8 33. Nf4 Qc8 34. Nfg6 Re8 35. Nxc6 Qc7+ 36. Nce5 Qxc3 37. Re3 Qd2 38. Kg2 Qxd4 39. f6 gxf6 40. Rxf6 Ne6 41. Rg3 Ng5 42. Ng4 Kg7 43. Nf4
comment:
Now White has some real
threats and practical chances. Bird: "Every move is an attack and demands
excessive vigilance on the part of the second player."

comment: Bird: The beginning of the end.

Kg2 d4 49. Ne5 Qc8 50. Ng6+
comment:
Black resigned
. Bird: A most tragical termination, the whole of the remaining army killed
with one shot.(50.Ng6+ Kg7 51.Nxe7+ Kxh6 would end with 52.Rg6#)
